metadata.title: Bell 206
aws::graph::propositions: The helicopter carrying General Officer Commanding of 55 Infantry Division and Jessore Area Commander Maj Gen Rafiqul Islam crashed.
Maj Gen Rafiqul Islam died in the helicopter crash.
Pilot Lt Col Islam died in the helicopter crash.
Co-pilot Major Saif sustained serious injuries in the helicopter crash.
A Bell 206B helicopter of the Missouri State Highway Patrol crashed on August 15, 2010.
The Bell 206B helicopter crashed after it ran out of fuel.
Sergeant Joseph George Schuengel was the pilot of the Bell 206B helicopter that crashed on August 15, 2010.
Sergeant Joseph George Schuengel was killed in the Bell 206B helicopter crash on August 15, 2010.
Guatemala's Chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces Rudy Ortiz was killed on August 20, 2014.
Rudy Ortiz's Bell 206 helicopter crashed on August 20, 2014.
Brazilian journalist Ricardo Boechat was killed on February 11, 2019.
The pilot of Bell 206B helicopter PT-HPG was killed on February 11, 2019.
Bell 206B helicopter PT-HPG crashed into a truck while attempting an emergency landing on a highway on February 11, 2019.
A sightseeing Bell 206 LongRanger IV (L-4) crashed on April 10, 2025.
The Bell 206 LongRanger IV crashed into the Hudson River off Newport, Jersey City.
All six occupants of the Bell 206 LongRanger IV were killed in the crash on April 10, 2025.

text:
The helicopter was carrying General Officer Commanding of 55 Infantry Division and Jessore Area Commander Maj Gen Rafiqul Islam. Maj Gen Islam and pilot Lt Col Islam died in the crash while co-pilot Major Saif sustained serious injuries.
On August 15, 2010, a Bell 206B of the Missouri State Highway Patrol crashed after it ran out of fuel, killing pilot Sergeant Joseph George Schuengel.
On August 20, 2014, Guatemala's Chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces Rudy Ortiz was killed when his Bell 206 crashed.
On February 11, 2019, Brazilian journalist Ricardo Boechat and the pilot were killed when Bell 206B, PT-HPG, crashed into a truck while attempting an emergency landing on a highway.
On April 10, 2025, a sightseeing Bell 206 LongRanger IV (L-4) crashed into the Hudson River off Newport, Jersey City, killing all six occupants.
